body:
Thanks for the issue and reproducer, @jbcurtin 

I'm trying to wrap my head around this. Your dataframe has 200,000 rows and 100 partitions, so each partition is 2000 rows.

And so by "window-range > window frame", you mean that the "size of the rolling window" is larger than the number of rows in a partition. Indeed this appears to be the case when in window size is 3,000:

Continuing from your example:
```python
for f in futures:
    print(f.result().isnull().all())

# False
# False
# True
# True
# True
```

If I have this right, you could (possibly) repartition your dataframe to match your window size as a work around. But I imagine there are cases where this isn't feasible. I also imagine there this a more robust and general fix that could go into the library. This isn't something I can take on right now, but I'll make sure someone with more experience sees this issue.
